question: Write a letter to the Planning Manager of your local council about a historical building in your area that is about to be pulled down due to the lack of money to repair it. In your letter:State why the building is importantWhat the building can be used for in the futureSuggest ways for paying for the repairs
text: I am writing this letter to bring your attention to the demolish the historical building at my place  which is located on Kent Street. As it is old and getting damaged it requires to renovate as soon as possible.

In addition, our area is popular and named after that complex because it is a beautifully constructed complex in 1960 by the Nizam ruler. Moreover, the design of walls, doors and windows are handmade. and rocks used to construct are not available now, which shows the material quality and architecture of those days. It was also a popular tourist spot. However, today the building is abandoned due to its age and needs to be repaired.

Moving further, this can be used for museum purposes which would be precious for next generations also to keep in touch with historical facts and the beauty of this building will attract more foreigners on the other hand it can be used as a library.
Furthermore, I want to recommend you  utilize the government funds for this social deed otherwise, citizens of my area agree to contribute some funds to renovate of symbolic momentum of heritage.
